text: Andrew Osmond (born 4 March 1967) is a contemporary British novelist. == Literary career == Osmond is the author of cult fiction titles such as Big Fish (2004), High (2004) and Young British Slacker (2006). Big Fish was described by SpikeSpike magazine description (accessed 30 Jan 2007) as a must read for wannabe globe-trotters, armchair travellers and mystery fans, alike. Midwest Book Reviews said of Young British Slacker: "...compels the readers' attention with its unique writing style and tactile-perfect realism in its stream of consciousness thoughts and emotions of a wage slave."Midwest book review opinion (accessed 30 Jan 2007) == References == Category:21st-century British novelists Category:English mystery writers Category:Living people Category:1967 births Category:British male novelists Category:21st-century British male writers
title: Andrew Osmond
